docs.snippet: When word got out that the Obama administration planned to approach the major sports leagues to promote reform, Republican leaders decided to commit interference....
docs.lead_paragraph: When word got out that the Obama administration planned to approach the major sports leagues to promote reform, Republican leaders decided to commit interference.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Republican leaders for drafting letters to top professional sports organizations discouraging them from helping publicize benefits of health care reform law; laments that letter seems to be working, with NFL saying it has no plans to join effort.

headline.main: A Chance for Pro Sports to Help on Health Care
headline.print_headline: A Chance for Pro Sports to Help on Health Care

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.snippet: With about 3 million registered Democrats in the city, Democratic canvassers can stand on a street corner and let the deluge pour forth, but it is not so easy for Republicans....
docs.lead_paragraph: With about 3 million registered Democrats in the city, Democratic canvassers can stand on a street corner and let the deluge pour forth, but it is not so easy for Republicans.
docs.abstract: Trailside blog; every New York City mayoral candidate needs 3,750 voter signatures to appear on primary ballot in September; with about 3 million registered Democrats in city, and only about 470,000 registered Republicans, volunteers for that party are having a tough time finding signatures for Republican hopefuls.

headline.main: How to Capture a Wild Republican
headline.print_headline:
How to Capture
A Wild Republican

docs.snippet: Prescription painkiller addiction, long seen as mainly a man’s problem, is rising at a far faster rate among women, a federal analysis of data found....
docs.lead_paragraph: Prescription painkiller addiction, long seen as mainly a man’s problem, is rising at a far faster rate among women, a federal analysis of data found.
docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention analysis finds that prescription painkiller addiction, long seen as mainly a man's problem, is rising at a far faster rate among women; more women now die of overdoses from pain pills like OxyContin than from cervical cancer or homicide.

headline.main: Sharp Rise in Women’s Deaths From Overdose of Painkillers
headline.print_headline: Sharp Rise in Women’s Deaths From Overdose of Painkillers

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
